intro: Conyza suffruticosa, commonly known as the roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a shrub-like species with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white to grayish hairs. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Conyza suffruticosa is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
